title: NYC shooting victims honored before HOF game
content: The NFL held a moment of silence before Thursday's Hall of Fame Game to honor the four people killed earlier this week by a shooter who was targeting league headquarters in New York.

title: Correa returning to Astros, this time to play 3B

content: Stanford is set to hire former Nike CEO John Donahoe as the school's new athletic director, sources told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Braves explode for 8, then allow 8 in historic inning
content: The Braves and Reds combined for 16 runs on 16 hits in the eighth inning Thursday night, marking just the third time in MLB history that both teams scored eight or more runs in the same inning.

title: Knicks, Bridges agree to 4-year, $150M extension
content: New York Knicks forward Mikal Bridges has agreed to a four-year, $150 million contract extension with the franchise, his agents told ESPN's Shams Charania on Thursday.

content: At just 12 years old, Yu Zidi won a bronze medal Thursday by swimming in the prelims of China's 4x200-meter freestyle relay team at the swim world championships.

title: 13-Year-Old Kidnapped For Ransom In Bengaluru, Burnt Body Recovered
content: The burnt body of a 13-year-old boy who had been reported missing on Wednesday was found at a deserted area along Kaggalipura Road in Bengaluru.

content: Canada has made a new diplomatic appointment in India, the first posting since a diplomatic row between New Delhi and Ottawa under former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's government.

title: Donald Trumps Tariffs Are Pushing This African Nations Economy To The Brink

title: Trump Brings Back Presidential Fitness Test For American Schoolchildren
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday reestablished the Presidential Fitness Test for American children, a fixture of public schools for decades that gauged young people's health and athleticism with 1-mile runs, sit-ups and stretching exercises.

title: Massive Disaster Management Mock Drill Carried Out At 55 Locations Across Delhi

title: PM Modi Praises Omar Abdullah's Gujarat Visit, Then A Request Follows
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Friday responded warmly to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's praise of his recent Gujarat visit, underscoring the critical importance of tourism for J&K's economy and national unity.

title: Probe Agency ED Raids Fake Call Centres In Delhi Duping US Citizens
content: The Enforcement Directorate has conducted searches in Delhi as part of a money laundering probe against a "fake" call centre which allegedly duped US citizens by pitching sale of "pirated" software, official sources said Friday.

title: In Fresh Probe Against Anil Ambani, Rs 68 Crore Fake Bank Guarantee Charge
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has widened its ongoing investigation into alleged financial irregularities involving the Anil Ambani Group, launching a parallel probe into a fake bank guarantee case worth Rs 68.2 crore, NDTV Profit reported.

title: Rain, Thunderstorms Likely In Delhi For Next 3 Days: Weather Office
content: The national capital is expected to witness a fresh spell of rain over the next three days, as IMD has forecast light to moderate showers accompanied by thunderstorms between Friday and Sunday (August 3).

title: Travis Hunter leads Madden NFL 26 rookie ratings
content: EA Sports has released the initial ratings for the NFL's rookie class . the top ten rookies as rated by Madden NFL 26 are the Jacksonville Jaguars cornerback Travis Hunter . Hunter claims the top spot with 84 OVR, sporting high general stats .

title: Divisional rankings: Zayas rises; a new king at flyweight

title: Mets find CF fix, trade for Orioles veteran Mullins
content: the Mets acquired center fielder cedric Mullins from the Baltimore Orioles . the 30-year-old is set to be a free agent after this season . he's hitting .229 with 15 home runs and a .738 OPS in 91 games for Baltimore .

content: upcoming iteration's Ultimate Team mode will feature a 12-game gauntlet every week . it will be the primary stomping ground for players to tackle challenges with escalating difficulty . the new Solo Champions mode is aimed at making MUT more attractive .

title: Insurance RB rankings: Charbonnet, Guerendo lead the way
content: Zach Charbonnet is a priority insurance running back for fantasy managers . this concept applies to fantasy football . he was rostered in just 22% of ESPN leagues entering Week 1 . but he emerged as a league winner after the Buccaneers' week 11 bye .

title: MLB trade deadline recap: Correa to Astros and all the moves that rocked deadline day
content: the 2025 trade deadline has officially passed, with contending teams making a flurry of late moves before 6 p.m. ET arrived . the San Diego Padres made a blockbuster move ahead of deadline day with a late-night deal with the Arizona Diamondbacks for Eugenio Suarez .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022, or the volume of last year . we did have two shocking trades: the Astros brought back former star Carlos Correa . the Athletics traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: Source: Commanders' McLaurin requests trade
content: a source says Terry McLaurin has requested a trade . he was frustrated with negotiations on a contract extension . there has been no movement toward a new deal, one source says . the commanders receiver could no longer be fined $50,000 per day .

The name is short for Pathiriyar, the Tamil word for a Christian priest.¬†Rev.¬†Ochs, a German missionary and pastor of the Tamil Evangelical Lutheran Church Holy Immanuel Church, came to¬†Mayiladuthurai¬†in 1845. He was the first to plant the sapling of this variety

content: An annual ritual in Visakhapatnam, Vrikshabandhan involves tying rakhis to trees as a gesture of respect and commitment to preserve them

content: Now, work on your emotional wellbeing at the office. Companies across India, from IT to design, are adding sound baths to structured team-building exercises for employees

title: In Bengaluru, meter off, fares up
content: The Regional Transport Authority of Bengaluru Urban district revised auto fares in the city limits on July 14, with the new rates coming into effect from August 1. While auto drivers are unhappy with the increase, commuters question the relevance of the decision when meters are hardly used and surge pricing by app-based aggregators is the norm

title: Review: Bride in the Hills | A Kuvempu magnum opus for the English reader
content: Set in the late 19th-century, this recent translation of the legendary Kannada writer‚Äôs 1967 novel is an exemplary work of social realism

title: Fishing in Kashmir, beneath the ice sheaths
content: Adept with harpoons in winter and nets in summer, the fishing communities here are relying on the government to save their lakes

title: Agrarian Rayalaseema‚Äôs dream for an industrial future
content: As mega industrial corridors and expressways reshape Rayalaseema‚Äôs landscape, an industrial future is poised to dawn over the region, which is grappling with declining agriculture and rising unemployment. The transformation has spurred interest in Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises among the youth, with many already scripting success. K. Umashanker speaks to the farmers who parted with their land for infrastructure development and the entrepreneurs betting big on economic boom

title: Cherlapalli terminal: All aboard the hype, but mind the gaps
content: Inaugurated with much fanfare as Hyderabad‚Äôs next big rail hub, the ‚Çπ430-crore Cherlapalli terminal was envisioned as a modern, congestion-busting alternative to Secunderabad station. But seven months after opening, the terminal remains hobbled by poor access roads, inadequate public transport, incomplete infrastructure and a disconnect between vision and execution. While the facade screams ambition, the functionality is far from future-ready, finds¬†V. Geetanath

title: Export Facilitation Centres supporting MSMEs, says Union Minister
content: In Andhra Pradesh alone, 50 MSMEs received support through the EFCs during 2024‚Äì25, Ms.¬† Karandlaje said

title: In Gurugram, silence in the service lanes
content: According to those living in the shadows of the city‚Äôs high-rise structures, the ongoing raids target Bengali-speaking migrants employed in the informal sector

title: ‚ÄòCoerced to bury 100 bodies‚Äô: SIT finds 15 bones in Dharmasthala forest pit
content: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) in Dharmasthala unearthed partial skeletal remains, suspected to be of a man, from a sixth burial site identified by a complainant alleging mass burials. The remains, found near the Netravathi river, included 15 bones.

title: Trump tariffs: Most and least affected countries- does India make it to either list?
content: In a significant move, the US has unveiled revised global tariff rates, impacting numerous nations and the EU. President Trump's Executive Order imposes tariffs from 10% to over 41%, factoring in geopolitical risks and trade imbalances. Syria, Laos, and Myanmar face the highest levies, while the UK and Brazil receive preferential 10% rates.

title: 'No support in male-dominated society': Divya becomes India‚Äôs 4th female GM; but why so few?
content: Divya Deshmukh's Grandmaster title highlights a gender disparity in Indian chess. Only four Indian women have achieved this rank, compared to over eighty men. Experts cite societal pressures, lack of support, and financial constraints as key factors. They emphasize the need for inclusive policies, coaching, and financial aid. This will encourage more women to pursue chess professionally.

title: Watch: Andhra minister‚Äôs brother slaps cop at temple; arrested
content: During a temple inauguration in Andhra Pradesh's Nandyal district, BC Janardhan Reddy's brother, Madana Bhoopal Reddy, slapped a police constable on duty. The incident, captured on video, triggered public outrage and led to Bhoopal Reddy's arrest. Minister Janardhan Reddy condemned the act, assuring that those responsible would face legal consequences, emphasizing the government's intolerance for such behavior.

title: Microsoft stops 30-year-old practice and drops Apple, IBM, Meta, Nvidia
content: Microsoft has stopped naming its competitors, such as Apple and Google, in its latest annual report, ending a nearly 30-year practice. The company now broadly describes the competitive landscape, citing the fast-moving nature of the markets. While executives still monitor rivals, this shift breaks from peers like Apple and Meta, who continue to name competitors.

title: 27-member Indian wushu team stranded in Shanghai after typhoon
content: A 27-member Indian wushu contingent is stranded in Shanghai after Typhoon Co-May caused flight cancellations and travel disruptions. The team, returning from the 12th Asian Junior Wushu Championships where they won nine medals, is awaiting confirmation of their rescheduled flight home. They were accommodated in a hotel in Shanghai amid fears of coastal surges.

title: DU introduces pause-and-resume option; here's how NEP rule will work
content: Delhi University has introduced the Multiple Entry and Multiple Exit (ME-ME) scheme under NEP 2020, allowing undergraduate students to pause and resume their degrees after completing any even semester. Credits remain valid for up to seven years, enabling students to re-enter without academic loss. This flexible structure aims to support diverse student needs and reduce dropout rates.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff says: I keep asking CEOs, what AI are they using..
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff disputes predictions of AI-driven job losses, asserting that AI primarily enhances human capabilities, despite Salesforce's own automation initiatives. He highlights AI's accuracy limitations, emphasizing the ongoing necessity of human oversight for fact-checking and strategic decision-making. Benioff anticipates AI will fuel a surge in small business creation by democratizing access to enterprise-level tools.

title: IND vs ENG: Nair earns plaudits for sportsmanship, stops for injured Woakes
content: During the India versus England 5th Test, Karun Nair displayed sportsmanship when Chris Woakes injured his shoulder while fielding. Nair refrained from taking an extra run out of respect. Woakes' injury appears serious, potentially ending his series. Gus Atkinson expressed concern and readiness to step in. Woakes has had a challenging series, taking only 11 wickets.

title: Not a single person has accepted the offer: Murati on her team rejecting Zuckerberg‚Äôs $1 bn offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI talent faced a significant setback as Thinking Machines Lab, led by Mira Murati, reportedly rejected lucrative offers, some reaching a billion dollars, to join Meta's Superintelligence Lab. Murati's team prioritized independence and long-term vision over substantial financial gains, highlighting the allure of shaping AI's future outside a corporate giant.

title: Himachal rain fury: Landslide near Pandoh Dam shuts Mandi-Kullu Highway
content: Heavy rainfall continues to wreak havoc in Himachal Pradesh, triggering a landslide near Pandoh Dam that shut down the Mandi-Kullu section of the Chandigarh-Manali Highway. Hundreds of roads remain blocked, with Mandi district being the worst hit. Rising river levels prompted the opening of Kol Dam floodgates.

title: After denied debut in 5th Test, India pacer Arshdeep poses with family in London - see pic
content: India's team selection for the final Test against England at The Oval sparked debate, especially regarding Arshdeep Singh's continued absence despite regaining fitness. While Arshdeep remained patient, Kuldeep Yadav and Abhimanyu Easwaran also awaited their opportunities. Ultimately, India opted for a pace-heavy attack, reflecting the recent dominance of fast bowlers at The Oval, as they aimed to level the series.

title: ‚ÄòMany laughed. Few believed‚Äô: Cong attacks govt over ED raids on Ambani
content: Congress has escalated its criticism of PM Modi, referencing Rahul Gandhi's 2018 allegations against Anil Ambani concerning a "Rs 1,30,000 crore surgical strike" on defense forces. This comes as the ED summoned Ambani for questioning in a Rs 17,000 crore loan fraud case, following raids on his properties.

title: Kidney health: How much water do you need to drink daily for healthy kidneys?
content: Water, essential for bodily functions and kidney health, requires nuanced intake based on individual factors like age, activity, and health conditions. Research links adequate hydration to reduced CKD risk, but overhydration can be harmful. Guidelines suggest 2.7-3.7 liters daily from all sources, with 1.5-2 liters of plain water recommended.

title: In Delhi, you don‚Äôt have to smoke to get lung cancer
content: Delhi faces a lung cancer crisis fueled by hazardous air quality, as highlighted on Lung Cancer Day. The APAC Consensus reveals a surge in cases linked to pollution, impacting even non-smokers. Doctors report a concerning rise in lung cancer among younger, non-smoking individuals, attributing it to vehicular emissions, industrial pollutants, and other environmental factors.

title: BSF jawan goes missing in Srinagar; search operations on
content: A Border Security Force jawan is missing. Sugam Choudhary is from the 60th Battalion. He was last seen at the battalion headquarters in Srinagar. Extensive searches are underway in nearby areas. Security forces have launched a large-scale operation. Police sources say there is no subversive angle. He may have left due to personal reasons. The investigation is ongoing.

title: Gold price: Outlook for August 1; why 'sell on rise' strategy makes sense?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold futures are facing pressure, struggling to recover, currently around ‚Çπ98,778. Technical indicators suggest a weak rebound, lacking bullish momentum. Experts advise a 'Sell on Rise' strategy near ‚Çπ99,000, with a stop-loss at ‚Çπ99,450, targeting ‚Çπ98,550 and ‚Çπ98,200. The trend remains vulnerable to declines until prices decisively break above the 21 EMA with strong volume.

title: 'One peace deal per month': White House pushes for Nobel Prize for Trump
content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt asserted that President Trump brokered numerous peace deals, averaging one per month, and deserves the Nobel Peace Prize. Leavitt cited a ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia, highlighting Trump's intervention and threat of halted trade negotiations. However, India has refuted Trump's claims of resolving conflicts with Pakistan, emphasizing bilateral resolutions.

title: CAT 2025 registration begins: Check direct link to apply online here
content: The CAT 2025 registration window is now open at iimcat.ac.in from August 1 to September 13. The exam, scheduled for November 30, is a gateway to IIMs and top B-schools. Candidates must register online, upload required documents, and pay the fee. Admit cards will be available from November 5, 2025.

title: No F-35 jets from US for India? Govt mulls next steps after 25% tariff shock
content: India is exploring options to address US President Trump's 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, but immediate retaliation is unlikely. While aiming to maintain trade relations by potentially increasing imports of natural gas, communication equipment, and gold from the US, India has ruled out new defense purchases, including the F-35 fighter jets.

title: Heartfelt top 50 messages for your girlfriend on national girlfriend day
content: National Girlfriend's Day, celebrated on August 1st, honors the profound connections between women, emphasizing friendship and mutual support. It's a day to appreciate the women who uplift and stand by you, whether they are best friends or romantic partners. The celebration focuses on female connection, offering thoughtful messages to express gratitude and love for the women who enrich our lives.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal DENIES romantic relationship with RJ Mahavash
content: Yuzvendra Chahal has finally addressed his divorce from Dhanashree Verma and the rumors linking him to RJ Mahavash. He clarified that he is not romantically involved with anyone and that Mahavash is a close friend who supported him during a difficult period.

title: UP IAS officer transferred 36 hours after sit-ups video goes viral
content: IAS officer Rinku Singh Rahi, known for his integrity and past exposure of a major scam, faced a swift transfer just 36 hours after assuming office as SDM in Shahjahanpur's Powayan. This followed a viral video showing him doing sit-ups as a symbolic gesture regarding public sanitation.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal recalls LAST conversation with ex-wife Dhanashree Verma
content: Yuzvendra Chahal addressed his divorce with Dhanashree Verma. He spoke about the viral T-shirt he wore during the proceedings. Chahal said the shirt was a response to something from Dhanashree's side. He mentioned a financial agreement was in place before the final decision. The couple agreed to keep their issues private on social media.

title: US visa logjam: Indian students stuck in the waiting room; will Marco Rubio open the door?
content: A bureaucratic visa bottleneck has left thousands of Indian students stranded ahead of the Fall 2025 semester, as U.S. consulates in India slash appointment slots amid new digital vetting rules. Despite bipartisan pressure on Secretary of State Marco Rubio to restore processing, the crisis threatens U.S.‚ÄìIndia educational ties, economic contributions, and America's global image as a welcoming academic destination.

title: Rummy row: Maharashtra minister loses agri portfolio, gets sports, minority affairs
content: Following a rummy controversy, NCP leader Ajit Pawar reassigned Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate to Sports and Youth Welfare, Minority Development, and Waqf. Dattatray Bharne will now head the agriculture department. This demotion followed Kokate's apology for the incident and assurances of improved behavior.

title: IND vs ENG: Gavaskar slams poor Jaiswal - 'There‚Äôs a bit of uncertainty'
content: Sunil Gavaskar has voiced concerns about Yashasvi Jaiswal's batting technique after his recent dismissal in the fifth Test. Gavaskar highlighted flaws in Jaiswal's footwork and shoulder positioning, impacting his ability to handle inswinging deliveries. India's top order struggled, leaving them at 204 for 6, needing a lower-order fightback to post a competitive total.

title: Stock market: Sensex down over 100 pts; shares weighed down by US tariffs
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday as India braces for 25% tariff rate on its exports to the US. While Nifty50 went below 24,750, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: 13-year-old's burnt body recovered in Bengaluru: Parents got late-night ransom call
content: A 13-year-old boy, Nischith A, was tragically found murdered in south Bengaluru after being abducted on Wednesday evening while returning from tuitions. His partially burnt body was discovered on Bannerghatta-Gottigere Road, following a ransom call to his parents.

title: Bangladeshi model held with fake Indian papers; here's how she got Aadhaar
content: Shanta Pal, a 28-year-old Bangladeshi woman and former airline crew member, has been arrested in Kolkata for allegedly possessing fake Indian identity documents. Pal, who also worked as a model and food vlogger, had been living in Kolkata with her parents on a valid passport.

title: Why did Trump hike tariff on Canada from 25% to 35%?
content: President Trump has escalated trade tensions by imposing a 35% tariff on Canadian imports, citing concerns over fentanyl and Palestine's statehood recognition. This action, effective August 7, excludes goods under the US-Mexico-Canada agreement and includes a transshipment levy.

title: States of emergency for New York & New Jersey: Key points
content: A powerful storm wreaked havoc across the US East Coast, prompting states of emergency in New York and New Jersey. Torrential rain transformed streets into rivers, crippling transportation and stranding commuters. New York City Mayor Eric Adams issued a travel advisory, urging residents to stay indoors.

title: Bihar polls: Nitish Kumar rolls out fresh sop; education workers' pay increased
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has announced a doubling of honorariums for education workers, including cooks, night watchmen, and physical education instructors, ahead of the upcoming assembly elections. This move aims to boost morale and dedication by increasing monthly salaries and annual increments.

title: Watch: Unbelievable! 41-yo AB de Villiers pulls off stunning last-ball heroic
content: AB de Villiers, at 41, showcased his brilliance in the World Championship of Legends semifinal, securing a thrilling 1-run victory for South Africa against Australia with a stunning last-ball run-out. Despite a quiet batting performance in the match, de Villiers has been a dominant force throughout the tournament, leading the run charts with two centuries.

title: Watch: Trump‚Äôs awkward attempt at pronouncing Tua Tagovailoa‚Äôs name goes viral
content: During a White House event, President Trump mispronounced Tua Tagovailoa's name while announcing the quarterback's appointment to the Presidential Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition. Despite the verbal stumble, Trump praised Tagovailoa's resilience, highlighting his comeback from injury. Tagovailoa's connection to the Trump family, including his wife's support and interactions with Ivanka Trump, adds another layer to his prominent role.

title: 'Was fighting lunatics like you': Trump slams reporter over tariff question - watch video
content: During a White House press conference, President Trump clashed with a reporter, labeling him a "lunatic" for questioning the timing of invoking the IEEPA to impose tariffs. Trump defended his actions, citing previous tariffs on China and accusing the media of inadequate coverage.

title: ‚ÄòHopefully, Alireza can kick Carlsen‚Äôs a**‚Äô: Nakamura after semifinal loss
content: In a thrilling Esports World Cup 2025 chess semifinal, Magnus Carlsen edged out Hikaru Nakamura 4‚Äì3, reaching the final after an Armageddon showdown. Nakamura, despite a strong King's Indian Defense win, narrowly missed victory. Carlsen will now face Alireza Firouzja for the top prize, while Nakamura competes for third place.

title: DMK councillor‚Äôs grandson arrested for ramming Loyola student to death in Chennai
content: In Chennai, three individuals, including Chandru alias Chandrasekar, grandson of a DMK functionary, have been arrested for the murder of Nithin Sai, a Loyola College student. Nithin Sai was killed in a deliberate car ramming incident following a dispute over a romantic relationship involving a female student. The police are searching for another suspect involved in the crime.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for August 1 - check list
content: Bajaj Broking Research suggests that Nifty will consolidate between 24,500-25,000, while Bank Nifty is expected to rise towards 57,500-58,300. Amidst US-India trade tensions and RBI rate decisions, Axis Bank is recommended for purchase between Rs 1050-1070, targeting Rs 1175. Larsen and Toubro is also a buy, within Rs 3590-3640, with expectations to reach Rs 3963.

title: Triple H entertains White House with signature spit move: Watch
content: WWE legend Triple H, also known as Paul Levesque, recently joined President Donald Trump at the White House for the revival of the Presidential Fitness Test. Levesque's signature water spit entrance on the White House steps went viral. Trump praised Triple H's influence as they aim to combat declining youth fitness by reintroducing structured physical education in schools.

title: IND vs ENG, 5th Test: Overcast sky, green pitch, moving ball - welcome to England, Day 1
content: The first day of the fifth England-India Test at The Oval favored England, with India struggling to 204/6 on a spicy, bowler-friendly pitch. Rain interruptions and inconsistent bowling, barring Gus Atkinson, added to India's woes. Despite Karun Nair's resilient fifty, aided by Washington Sundar, India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hopes they can reach 300, praising Sai Sudharsan's patient innings.

title: Crude calculations: Trump's oil deal with Pak - a move to counter China, pressure India?
content: Donald Trump's announcement of a deal to develop Pakistan's oil reserves is viewed with skepticism. Experts suggest it's a strategic move to counter China's influence and pressure India on trade, rather than a reflection of Pakistan's immediate hydrocarbon potential. The viability of these reserves remains unproven, requiring significant investment and time, especially given the risky locations.

title: I was in love with Kavin, but my parents are ‚Äòinnocent‚Äô: Subhashini
content: According to her, Surjith wanted Kavin to meet her parents as he felt her marriage would pave way for his ‚Äúprogress‚Äù

title: Supreme Court dismisses anticipatory bail of IPS officer Sanjay, asks him to surrender in three weeks ¬†
content: ACB booked a case against him for ‚Äòmanipulating‚Äô tender processes while he was Director General of A.P. State Disaster Response & Fire Services

title: False cases being filed against YSRCP leaders for questioning govt., alleges Jagan
content: The YSRCP chief calls on former MLAs ‚Äî Kakani Govardhan Reddy in prison and Prasanna Kumar Reddy at his residence

title: Babulal Marandi accuses Hemant Soren government of falsely implicating Hindu leaders
content: During the monsoon session starting from August 1, the Jharkhand government will present the first supplementary budget of the current financial year as well as several bills including the University Bill-2025 in the House.

title: Gujar youth was killed in cold blood: Mehbooba¬†
content: The killing of Parvez is part of a chilling pattern of violence, with over a dozen Gujjar-Bakerwal men dying in suspicious circumstances in 2024-25, the former CM said

title: Tusker tramples three to death in Odisha
content: Villagers allege the precise locations of wild elephants are not being communicated to them¬† effectively

title: Tripartite river management project between West Bengal, Bihar, Jharkhand in the works: West Bengal Minister
content: West Bengal Minister Manas Ranjan Bhunia said the proposed project aims to control soil erosion by the Ganga in Malda, close to the Bihar and Jharkhand borders

title: BSP chief Mayawati slams United States trade tariffs, urges Union govt. to use it as opportunity for self-reliance¬†
content: United States President Donald Trump on July 30 announced a 25% tariff on Indian goods from August 1, with an additional but unspecified ‚Äúpenalty‚Äù for its defence and energy imports from Russia

title: CBSE delinks building of more classes from land availability
content: The construction of sections or classes will be linked to the total built-up carpet area of the school building instead of land acreage

title: Mohan Majhi Govt to plant 75 lakh saplings in a single day to celebrate birthday of PM Narendra Modi¬†
content: Odisha CM emphasised planting of climate-resilient and fruit-bearing species, tailored to local ecological conditions

title: Rajbhar‚Äôs Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party decides to contest Bihar election
content: The two term MLA and cabinet minister in Uttar Pradesh government, Mr. Rajbhar asserted that he is in talks with the NDA but if not given respectable seats then ready to go solo.

title: No school closure, no post cuts on cards, U.P. Minister clarifies over school merger¬†
content: The Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav claimed that the government was forced to take back the decision due to the opposition pressure and protest

title: With eye on Assembly polls, West Bengal CM hikes honorarium to community Durga Pujas by 30 %
content: The hike in honorarium to community Durga Pujas from ‚Çπ85,000 last year to ‚Çπ1.1 lakh this year comes months ahead of Assembly polls in West Bengal.

title: Himachal sees four Cabinet meetings in four days; approves OBC quota in ULB polls
content: The Cabinet meetings between July 28 till July 31 were chaired by Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu in which several decisions were taken

title: GCDA plans to transfer KK Road to Kochi Corporation after restoration work
content: While the GCDA can undertake minor repair works, such as filling potholes, large-scale restoration works and resurfacing are not feasible, unlike the Corporation, which has a separate allocation for road maintenance

title: Rights panel asks Collector to take urgent steps against over-speeding by private buses
content: District Police Chief asked to probe reasons leading to the death of a student after being fatally knocked down by bus

title: Thripunithura blast: NGT gives last chance to submit action taken report
content: The district authorities had filed a report before the tribunal stating that they were yet to receive a response from the government regarding the award of compensation, as it involved a substantial amount

title: Kochi Corporation allocates ‚Çπ5 lakh per zone to repair roads on war footing
content: Affected stretches will be resurfaced once the rain subsides, says Mayor; PWD, GIDA, GCDA, NHAI told to take action in the case of roads under their control

title: Maharashtra Minister Kokate shunted out of Agriculture Ministry following ‚Äòrummy in House‚Äô row
content: Dattatrey Bharne, the current Sports Minister, will be the new Agriculture Minister, said a notification issued by the General Administration Department

title: Upalokayukta calls for replication of Rayanakere waste treatment plants in other districts of Karnataka
content: Officials instructed to conduct a public impact assessment in a 5-10 km radius around waste management units to ensure that the residents in the nearby area were not affected

title: Bangladeshi model arrested from Kolkata with Indian passport
content: The development comes at a time when security agencies are cracking down on Bangladeshi nationals in different parts of the country including West Bengal.

title: Durga Puja organisers will get honorarium of ‚Çπ1.10 lakh: Mamata
content: CM‚Äôs announcement, which will cost the exchequer ‚Çπ495 cr., is a 30% increase over last year‚Äôs ‚Çπ85,000; Oppn. terms the increase a ‚Äòbribe‚Äô

title: Tamil Nadu most resilient State, prepared to face any trade barriers, says Industries Minister
content: T.R.B. Rajaa said Tamil Nadu was prepared to face the tariffs even before Donald Trump was elected as the U.S. President

title: Doctors‚Äô association urges government to act on paraquat poisoning
content: The Healthcare Reforms Doctors Association urges the Telangana Government to take action against paraquat poisoning, proposing strict regulations and safety protocols for herbicide use

title: SHElterTech launched in Hyderabad
content: The project is an initiative under the ShelterTech platform, co-led by WE Hub and TSIC- Habitat for Humanity

title: How not to identify an illegal immigrant
content: People are being detained by the police simply because they speak a certain dialect or wear a particular garment
